docs.snippet: United States amateur boxers met defeat tonight in the Pan-American championships, Bobby Carroll of Trenton, N. J., and Frank Mullane of Detroit both losing decisions. Carroll was outpointed by the Chilean flyweight, Luis Porteles. Mullane, a...
docs.lead_paragraph: United States amateur boxers met defeat tonight in the Pan-American championships, Bobby Carroll of Trenton, N. J., and Frank Mullane of Detroit both losing decisions. Carroll was outpointed by the Chilean flyweight, Luis Porteles. Mullane, a featherweight, dropped the verdict to Vital Coccio of Argentina.

headline.main: TWO U. S. BOXERS LOSE; Carroll and Mullane Beaten by South American Amateurs

docs.snippet: The Cuban delegation to the Pan-American Conference at Lima, Peru, in December will be headed by Secretary of State Juan J. Remos, it was announced by the Department of State this afternoon.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Cuban delegation to the Pan-American Conference at Lima, Peru, in December will be headed by Secretary of State Juan J. Remos, it was announced by the Department of State this afternoon.

byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Bradley Lewis, New York middleweight, continued to advance through the Pan American amateur boxing championships in the sixth night of competition tonight, but Robert Carroll, flyweight from Trenton, N. J., was beaten, Lewis outpointed Mario Schoub...
docs.lead_paragraph: Bradley Lewis, New York middleweight, continued to advance through the Pan American amateur boxing championships in the sixth night of competition tonight, but Robert Carroll, flyweight from Trenton, N. J., was beaten, Lewis outpointed Mario Schoub of Brazil, and Carroll lost to Juan Trillo of Argentina.

headline.main: LEWIS WINS IN RING; New Yorker Defeats Schoub in Buenos Aires Bout

docs.snippet: Dr. Stephen Duggan, director of the Institute of International Education, announced yesterday the names of 134 American students who have received fellowship awards for study in other countries during the academic year 1938-39.
docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Stephen Duggan, director of the Institute of International Education, announced yesterday the names of 134 American students who have received fellowship awards for study in other countries during the academic year 1938-39.
docs.abstract: Chilean Govt awards to U S students

headline.main: AWARDS GO TO 134 FOR STUDY ABROAD; American Students Named by International Education Body for a Year's Work MOST WILL GO TO EUROPE Girls Are Listed for Japan and Uruguay-Three Special Prizes for France

docs.snippet: Jim Reddick, light-heavyweight from St. Louis and the only North American fighter to see action on the card, outpointed Joaquin Mosquera of Uruguay before 15,000 fans in the seventh round of the PanAmerican amateur boxing championships tonight.
docs.lead_paragraph: Jim Reddick, light-heavyweight from St. Louis and the only North American fighter to see action on the card, outpointed Joaquin Mosquera of Uruguay before 15,000 fans in the seventh round of the PanAmerican amateur boxing championships tonight.

headline.main: REDDICK SCORES IN RING; U. S. Fighter Defeats Mosquera in Pan-American Tourney
